meanings.definition: To book or reserve in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always prebook my movie tickets to make sure I get good seats.
meanings.sent2: It is a good idea to prebook your hotel room before your trip.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken prebook a table at the restaurant? To avoid waiting in line!
meanings.sent4: She decided to prebook her success by studying hard for the exam.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to prebook your spot in the workshop to secure your spot!

meanings.sent1: The prebook for the event was sold out within hours.
meanings.sent2: I made a prebook for the concert next month.
meanings.sent3: The prebook for the new video game caused excitement among gamers.
meanings.sent4: His prebook for the vacation package saved him money in the long run.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to make a prebook for the conference before all the spots are taken!
